response_parsed.title: Combining stat and Typing in Python 3.12+ for Production Code
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to leverage the power of the stat module for file system operations and Typing for type hints in a production-ready manner, utilizing features specific to Python 3.12+.
key_points: Using Type Hints (Type) for clearer code
Utilizing Union Types (Union) for handling multiple file types
Employing Class Variables for improving readability

code_examples.code:
from typing import Cast, Union

class File:
  path: str
  size: int
  atime: float
  mtime: float

  def __init__(self, path: str) -> None:
    self.path = path
    self.size = Cast(int, os.stat(path).st_size)
    self.atime = Cast(float, os.stat(path).st_atime)
    self.mtime = Cast(float, os.stat(path).st_mtime)

file: Union[File, FileBuffer] = File("example.txt")

version_notes: Features utilized in this explainer are specific to Python 3.12+
For earlier versions, use `typing_extensions` package for Cast and Union
caveats: Ensure to handle exceptions when dealing with filesystem operations
Type hints are not enforced at runtime unless using tools like Mypy or Pytype
